text: [Music]
the reason why I wanted to pinpoint oil
spills was because there has been a lot
of talk about the Dakota pipeline and
the reason why people don't want this is
because oil spills are a huge issue
which can occur obviously from pipelines
and these oil spills can contaminate
drinking water sources and harm wildlife
hi my name is anneka vog wa tuula and
i'm 14 years old and I'm in eighth grade
and so I wanted to find a natural
assortment which could clean up these
oil spills and would replace harmful
remediation solutions which while
effective can damage the environment
right now this is the solvent that I use
to clean up oil from oil spills so I
wanted to focus on using the parts of
fruit or natural materials that are
typically thrown away I've tested
different types of storm of materials
banana peels pomegranate husks and
orange peels and I found that
pomegranate husks and orange peels were
the most effective so I first tested the
amount of time it took to remove the oil
from the water then I wanted to find the
optional weights of the sorban I also
wanted to find the optional mix since
pomegranate husks worked better in fresh
water and orange peels worked better in
salt water then I tested the solvent in
motor oil and I found that it was very
effective absorbing 2 to 3 times its own
weight depending on the size of the oil
so different types of different sizes of
solvents can be used and maybe this
should be targeted for more pipeline
spills which are smaller and since this
is adsorption so what that means is the
oil is coated on the outside of the
peels it can be assumed that with
high-pressure compression oil can be
extracted from the sorban and then it
can be read since the composition hasn't
been changed the next step that I would
like to do with my mentor is to find the
biodegradable materials to put the
filling or put the sorban in so that the
whole product will be biodegradable and
can be used for oil spills as a natural
material
